info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 4 at 4:13PM MST until September 4 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 500 PM MST.
* At 412 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Olberg to near Chandler Fashion Center Mall to 8 miles southeast of Estrella Mountain Park to 6 miles northeast of Estrella, moving north at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 30 mph.
SOURCE...Doppler radar.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 128 and 174. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 208. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 9.
Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Glendale, Gilbert, Tempe, Avondale, Goodyear, Paradise Valley, Tolleson, Sun Lakes, Laveen, Cashion, Litchfield Park, and Tempe Marketplace.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
